triples.name: Evolutionary game theory
triples.relevance: The paper discusses the current state and future directions of evolutionary game theory as the primary subject.

triples.name: Evolution
triples.relevance: Evolution is a fundamental concept underlying evolutionary game theory and its applications.

triples.name: Cooperation
triples.relevance: Cooperation is explicitly mentioned as one of the few popular issues in evolutionary game theory.

triples.name: Reciprocity (evolution)
triples.relevance: Reciprocity is mentioned as a key concept treated differently across different fields in evolutionary game theory research.

triples.name: Spatial ecology
triples.relevance: Spatial structure is mentioned as an important concept in evolutionary game theory that is treated differently across disciplines.

triples.name: Algorithm
triples.relevance: Computer scientists use algorithms to explore evolutionary game theory models and simulations.

triples.name: Machine learning
triples.relevance: The paper mentions machines learning from the environment and from each other, reflecting machine learning concepts.

triples.name: Biology
triples.relevance: Biology is the source discipline from which evolutionary game theory originated and from which insights are transferred.

triples.name: Ecology
triples.relevance: Ecology is mentioned as a related field where evolutionary game theory insights are applied and developed.

triples.name: Computer science
triples.relevance: Computer science is one of the contributing disciplines that applies evolutionary game theory to new domains.
